summary: This is a fantasy preset optimized for Vivid Weathers. It comes with two Versions: the light version has a brighter look and the dark version has higher blacklevel to it. Choose your favorite.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://i.imgur.com/DtdTzzH.png[/img]
[color=#f9cb9c]Welcome to Sunnstede![/color]
Sunnstede is Old Englisch and means solstice. The name says it all: you can choose between two versions. The light version is a preset with a bright look and high brightness. The dark version has higher blacklevel and because of that it is a bit darker. The screenshots all have the name of the related version. Maybe you have to go to page two to see the other version because I didn't want to mix the order.
I highly recommend using [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73937/?]Vivid Weathers[/url] as both versions of the preset were created based on it's lighting.

[img]http://i.imgur.com/mxNjTFe.jpg[/img]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/kX5U3CK.jpg[/img][/center]


[img]http://i.imgur.com/luPSNZn.png[/img]
[center][youtube]0FPboR4cjt8[/youtube] [youtube]Vdp0J7nbDBM[/youtube][/center]

[img]http://i.imgur.com/AyrjUxK.png[/img]
1. Download and install [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73937/?]Vivid Weathers[/url]. To do this, please follow the instructions on the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/73937/?]Vivid Weathers[/url] Nexus page.
2. Download the ENB version 0.308 from [url=http://enbdev.com/mod_tesskyrim_v0308.htm]ENBdev[/url].
3. Extract all the files within the "Wrapper" directory in the archive into your Skyrim folder (.../steamapps/common/skyrim).
4. Download my ENB preset and extract all the files either from within the 'Dark Preset' or the 'Light Preset' folder into your Skyrim directory (.../steamapps/common/skyrim). [color=#ff0000]Overwrite all files if asked.[/color]
5. Set the following values in your SkyrimPrefs.ini (.../documents/my games/skyrim) and save the file:

[color=#f9cb9c][center]iMaxAnisotropy=0
iMultiSample=0
bFloatPointRenderTarget=1[/center][/color]

[center][u][color=#ff0000]Important:[/color][/u] If you are using Mod Organizer, please set these values with the Ini Editor.[/center]


6. You are done, enjoy!

[img]http://i.imgur.com/dNkaIeh.png[/img]

Special credits go to Boris Vorontsov for creating the ENB binaries!
Also special credits go to soulwynd for providing his awesome [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/44752/?]DoF[/url] for ENBs.
I also want to give credits to SkyrimTuner as I'm using his effect.txt from his RealVision ENB.
Last but not least I want to thank Ceejay.dk for providing the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/23364/?]SweetFX Shader Suite[/url].
author: Zeratem

files.name: Sunnstede ENB
files.changelogHtml: Disabled SubSurfaceScattering which was causing some skin textures to be bright red.
